articles.author: Casey Hall, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China launched military drills around Taiwan on Saturday as a "serious warning" to separatist forces in an angry but widely expected response to Vice President William Lai's visit to the United States, drawing condemnation from Taipei.
articles.title: China launches drills in angry response to Taiwan vice president's trip to US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egypt's President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi has pardoned a number of prisoners, including prominent Egyptian activist Ahmed Douma, the state TV said on Saturday.
articles.title: Egypt's president pardons activist Douma, other prisoners -state TV

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Saudi Arabian Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian on Friday in the highest-level talks since the countries reconciled in March after years of bitter rivalry that destabilised the region.
articles.title: Saudi crown prince meets Iran's foreign minister as relations thaw

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived in Sweden on Saturday to meet with Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson, the royal family and other officials as a Kyiv counteroffensive against Russian forces grinds into its third month.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy visits Sweden to meet PM, royal family

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand's self-exiled former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra plans to return to the country on Tuesday, his daughter said on Saturday, amid prolonged political uncertainty after a May national election.
articles.title: Thai ex-PM Thaksin to return from exile Tuesday, daughter says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea slammed a recent United Nations meeting about its human rights record, asserting the United States used the international organisation for a "scheme" against Pyongyang, state media KCNA reported on Saturday.
articles.title: North Korea slams UN human rights meeting as a US 'scheme'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five people were killed and 37 wounded when a Russian missile struck a central square in the northern Ukrainian city of Chernihiv, the interior ministry said on Saturday.
articles.title: Five killed, 37 wounded in Russian missile strike on Ukrainian city of Chernihiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Social media company X, formerly known as Twitter, will remove a protective feature that lets users block other accounts, owner Elon Musk said on Friday in another controversial move for the company he bought last year.
articles.title: Elon Musk says X will strip ability to block accounts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine armed forces said on Saturday it would again seek to resupply troops stationed in a rusty World War 2-era ship on a reef in the South China Sea, after China blocked a previous attempt with water cannons.
articles.title: Philippines to resupply South China Sea troops after Beijing's block
